column4: but i eventually figured it out some how, i forget exactly how
i think i had to reboot
how the heck do i unmount a NTFS?
no
i have no idea!
its a USB NTFS HDD
ok how do i find it
is it in the mounted volume or where?
i know how to find the address but which icon is the correct address
ok
the path shuld be  /media/nameofthedriveonyourdesktop

in ubuntu  ntfs partitions are read only by default,  it is not someting wrong that you did,  to make them read/wirte you need to perform a few extra operations,  I am not sure they will be permanent with a usb drive
if it appears on your desktop just rightl click and pick unmount in the menu
from the terminal    sudo umount /media/Black64
great
try just unpluging and plugging in it ,  usb should mount automaticaly
make sure it is powered on
internal drives  is  sudo mount /dev/sd**  /mountpoint
you need to have a mountpoint made    sudo mkdir /****     use something in /media if you want it to show on your desktop or  in /mnt if you don'T
we love you to
sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop
